decks.notes: The key concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly with mana accelerators like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Mwonvuli Acid-Moss and Thermokarst. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early with aggressive creatures such as Avenging Hunter and Annoyed Altisaur, while generating value with Generous Ent and Writhing Chrysalis. Malevolent Rumble serves as a finisher to close out games. Overall, the deck focuses on fast mana development and aggressive creature beats to overwhelm the opponent.

This Orzhov Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with low-cost creatures and removal spells. By using efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Inspiring Overseer, combined with removal spells such as Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes, the deck can quickly disrupt opponents' plans and deal damage. Tithing Blade and Lembas provide additional ways to boost creature power, while cards like Thraben Inspector and Refurbished Familiar help to maintain card advantage. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Vault of Whispers to provide additional resources and disruption options.

The main focus of this deck is to control the pace of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures. The use of gates allows for easy mana fixing and synergy with cards like Guardian of the Guildpact. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building up its own board presence with creatures like Squadron Hawk and Dawnbringer Cleric. With a mix of card draw, removal, and protection spells, this deck looks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The main idea behind this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to play low-cost, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tolarian Terror while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and bounce spells like Boomerang. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard manipulation with spells like Brainstorm, Thought Scour, and Deep Analysis to maintain pressure on the opponent. The overall strategy is to quickly establish a board presence and control the game tempo through efficient spells and disruptive tactics.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana using walls such as Overgrown Battlement and Axebane Guardian, while also utilizing creatures like Saruli Caretaker and Avacyn's Pilgrim to ramp up mana production. The deck aims to create a wall of defenders to protect against opponents' attacks, while also utilizing combo pieces like Freed from the Real and Galvanic Alchemist to generate infinite mana. With this mana advantage, the deck can then play powerful finishers like Valakut Invoker or Reaping the Graves to secure victory.

This Elves aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with cheap mana-producing creatures and using cards like Timberwatch Elf to pump up the team. The deck also includes card draw spells like Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody to refill the hand with more Elves. With the ability to generate large amounts of mana thanks to Priest of Titania and other mana creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Elves before they can establish a defense.

This deck focuses on using flicker effects like Ephemerate to repeatedly generate value from cards like Mulldrifter and Augur of Bolas. By constantly bouncing creatures and triggering enter-the-battlefield effects, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also controlling the game with cards like Counterspell and Skred. The combo potential with Archaeomancer and Ephemerate allows for repeated use of powerful spells like Cleansing Wildfire or LÃ³rien Revealed to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Cast into the Fire helps to deal with threats while maintaining the combo engine.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to effectively control the game through countering opponent's spells and removal effects, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred. Card advantage is key with spells like Preordain and Brainstorm, allowing for strategic planning and decision-making. Creatures like Murmuring Mystic and Tolarian Terror can provide additional threats on the board. The deck also utilizes snow lands for synergy with certain cards. Overall, the deck aims to outsmart and outlast opponents through strategic control and damage.

The key concept of this deck is to use walls to generate mana and create a combo with creatures that benefit from high mana production. By using cards like Saruli Caretaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Axebane Guardian to generate mana, the deck aims to play powerful creatures like Avenging Hunter and Annoyed Altisaur. The combo is further supported by Quirion Ranger, Writhing Chrysalis, and Galvanic Alchemist. The deck also includes card draw and creature searching spells like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede to maintain consistency. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creature plays and mana production.
